content.question: A <math alttext="1.50 gram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.50</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of an oxide of vanadium is separated into its elements, resulting in <math alttext="1.02 grams of V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.02</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="0.48 gram of O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.48</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is the formula of the oxide?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
